channel.title: Jerry Jalava replaces amputated finger with 2GB USB stick
channel.description:
[b]A COMPUTER nerd who lost a finger in a motorbike crash had it replaced with a USB drive - and now boasts about having the world's only 2GB digit.[/b] Helsinki software developer Jerry Jalava built the special prosthetic finger, which contains storage for photos, movies, music and other useful files, himself. It looks like a normal finger but he can peel it back from the "nail" and plug it into a computer USB slot. Jalava had half his finger amputated after crashing his Ducati motorbike last year. He said of the prosthetic: "It is not attached permanently into my body, it is a removable prosthetic which has a USB memory stick inside it. "When I'm using the USB, I just leave my finger inside the slot and pick it up after I'm ready."
sauce: http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,25204325-5012895,00.html That's quite.. unique.

item.title: Jerry Jalava replaces amputated finger with 2GB USB stick
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Somewhere I found they were starting to make basic cpu type things out of neurons… The split them then layed them out in lines! Crazy!

Read full topic

item.title: Jerry Jalava replaces amputated finger with 2GB USB stick
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Fat Cookies:

God knows what’s going to happen next, possibly a real person with a cpu inside their brain to boost their “inteligence”?

You can try, but it’ll be close to a brain tumor. I’m not great in medicine, but I guess the body will attack it and make a clot around it?

Read full topic

item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:5, topic:268211”][quote author=cooper link=topic=353996.msg2712408#msg2712408 date=1237407180]

wow… what happens if the pc is like on the other side of the room lol… He’d have to take his finger off. Oh an imagine if he pulled his finger out while transferring data.

It’s a removable prosthetic.
[/quote][/quote]

He said of the prosthetic: "It is not attached permanently into my body, it is a removable prosthetic which has a USB memory stick inside it.

“When I’m using the USB, I just leave my finger inside the slot and pick it up after I’m ready.”
